title: Provide a downloadable UI text file for editing

requirements.text: Add a user-accessible download option that provides the current plain-text UI translations file as a direct file download in the browser (same format as `frontend/src/texts/ui-texts.txt`: `KEY = English | Spanish`).
acceptanceCriteria: A user can click a control in the UI and their browser downloads a `.txt` file containing the UI translations in the existing plain-text format.
The downloaded file contents match the appâ€™s current translation source (including comments and section headers) and are not missing any keys.
The download works in a production build (not only in local dev).

requirements.text: Update the plain-text workflow documentation to include clear instructions on how to download the translations text file from the app UI and where that file maps in the repository.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/UI_TEXT_PLAIN_TEXT_WORKFLOW.md` documents the exact UI location/steps to download the `.txt` file.
Documentation names the repository source file (`frontend/src/texts/ui-texts.txt`) and the downloaded filename users should expect.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI library components).
Do not edit the immutable hook/entry paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them instead).
nonGoals: Implementing an in-app editor for translations.
Adding backend storage or persistence for translations.
Adding third-party localization platforms or integrations.
